This game is extremely frustrating with an extremely toxic community and playerbase. Don't buy this game if you are not willing to farm hundreds of hours and endure an extreme amount of bullshit for killer/survivor perks and items. Definitely do not buy this game if you anger easily and are triggered by you're own incompetence.
Muy bueno el juego, lo recomiendo

It can seem intimidating at first, when you're brand new and unfamiliar with everything the game throws at you. The different perks, the different killers, the often unpredictable mindset and strategy of your teammates and the killer, it will, WILL take some time to adapt. But when you do, and manage to really pull some stuff off, that's when it's worth it. It helps to watch some gameplay online of more experienced players, and there's a lot you can learn from them. While it can be a buggy, unfair game at times, the rest of the time it's pretty dang fun, especially with a pal or two.
Buenardo, una locura de juego si tenes amigos, si no retirate bro o juga de asesino

Survivors are terribly overpowered. Killer is always much worse, you have to use the best perks at ranks 1-5 or else you just will not do well. High rank survivors just learn how to run in circles and keep you from hitting while their whole team gets 4 gens done in about 30 seconds. Balance is never killer-favored.

Despite the horror scenario the game experience is actually quite chill and relaxing.

Over 740 hours later, I am still never bored of this game. Not perfect, as lag from bad killer hosts can be bad, but lately it wasn't as terrible as it was around 2017, 2018. I typically put 90% of my time in this game as a Survivor (Meg), but with so many new killers, I recently started testing them out and like the different play and feels like another side to the game I just never put time to and enjoy it. The DLC that drops seemingly every 3-4 months is inexpensive enough (about $7 a pack that brings new map, new killer, new survivor, each with unique perks for balancing that are teachable to be brought to your favorite player), and go on sale so often I don't mind picking them up and supporting the devs who still make this game so much fun and fresh even 4 years later! I'm totally fine with them doing this for years and years, but if they want to make a sequel game, just follow same model: $20 base game, and release cheap DLC that's rich in content every 3-5 months maybe 6-8 months after launch.

Great game super fun to play but its hard to continue enjoying it whenever the hit boxes don't work correctly. I hate being behind the killer or behind a wall and getting hit by them whenever they swing and it takes the fun out  of the game.
